trans-unit.source: NetworkConfiguration Schema
trans-unit.target: NetworkConfiguration Schema

trans-unit.source: NetworkConfiguration Schema
trans-unit.target: NetworkConfiguration Schema

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element of the service configuration file specifies Virtual Network and DNS values.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element of the service configuration file specifies Virtual Network and DNS values.

trans-unit.source: These settings are optional for cloud services.
trans-unit.target: These settings are optional for cloud services.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following resource to learn more about Virtual Networks and the associated schemas:
trans-unit.target: You can use the following resource to learn more about Virtual Networks and the associated schemas:

trans-unit.source: Azure Service Configuration Schema
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Configuration Schema

trans-unit.source: Azure Service Definition Schema
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Definition Schema

trans-unit.source: Virtual Network Overview
trans-unit.target: Virtual Network Overview

trans-unit.source: Configure a Virtual Network Using Network Configuration Files
trans-unit.target: Configure a Virtual Network Using Network Configuration Files

trans-unit.source: Virtual Network Schema
trans-unit.target: Virtual Network Schema

trans-unit.source: About Network Access Control Lists (ACLs)
trans-unit.target: About Network Access Control Lists (ACLs)

trans-unit.source: NetworkConfiguration Element
trans-unit.target: NetworkConfiguration Element

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element and its child elements.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element and its child elements.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the child elements of the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the child elements of the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Element
trans-unit.target: Element

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: AccessControl
trans-unit.target: AccessControl

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the rules for access to endpoints in a cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the rules for access to endpoints in a cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The access control name is defined by a string for <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The access control name is defined by a string for <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>AccessControl</languageKeyword> element contains one or more <languageKeyword>Rule</languageKeyword> elements.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>AccessControl</languageKeyword> element contains one or more <languageKeyword>Rule</languageKeyword> elements.

trans-unit.source: More than one <languageKeyword>AccessControl</languageKeyword> element can be defined.
trans-unit.target: More than one <languageKeyword>AccessControl</languageKeyword> element can be defined.

trans-unit.source: Rule
trans-unit.target: Rule

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the action that should be taken for a specified subnet range of IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the action that should be taken for a specified subnet range of IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: The order of the rule is defined by a string value for the <languageKeyword>order</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The order of the rule is defined by a string value for the <languageKeyword>order</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The lower the rule number the higher the priority.
trans-unit.target: The lower the rule number the higher the priority.

trans-unit.source: For example, rules could be specified with order numbers of 100, 200, and 300.
trans-unit.target: For example, rules could be specified with order numbers of 100, 200, and 300.

trans-unit.source: The rule with the order number of 100 takes precedence over the rule that has an order of 200.
trans-unit.target: The rule with the order number of 100 takes precedence over the rule that has an order of 200.

trans-unit.source: The action for the rule is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>action</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The action for the rule is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>action</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>permit</languageKeyword> – Specifies that only packets from the specified subnet range can communicate with the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>permit</languageKeyword> – Specifies that only packets from the specified subnet range can communicate with the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>deny</languageKeyword> – Specifies that access is denied to the endpoints in the specified subnet range.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>deny</languageKeyword> – Specifies that access is denied to the endpoints in the specified subnet range.

trans-unit.source: The subnet range of IP addresses that are affected by the rule are defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>remoteSubnet</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The subnet range of IP addresses that are affected by the rule are defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>remoteSubnet</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The description for the rule is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>description</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The description for the rule is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>description</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: EndpointAcl
trans-unit.target: EndpointAcl

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the assignment of access control rules to an endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the assignment of access control rules to an endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The name of the role that contains the endpoint is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>role</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the role that contains the endpoint is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>role</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The name of the endpoint is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>endpoint</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the endpoint is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>endpoint</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The name of the set of <languageKeyword>AccessControl</languageKeyword> rules that should be applied to the endpoint are defined in a string for the <languageKeyword>accessControl</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the set of <languageKeyword>AccessControl</languageKeyword> rules that should be applied to the endpoint are defined in a string for the <languageKeyword>accessControl</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: More than one <languageKeyword>EndpointAcl</languageKeyword> elements can be defined.
trans-unit.target: More than one <languageKeyword>EndpointAcl</languageKeyword> elements can be defined.

trans-unit.source: DnsServer
trans-unit.target: DnsServer

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the settings for a DNS server.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the settings for a DNS server.

trans-unit.source: You can specify settings for DNS servers without a Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: You can specify settings for DNS servers without a Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: The name of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The IP address of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>IPAddress</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The IP address of the DNS server is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>IPAddress</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: The IP address must be a valid IPv4 address.
trans-unit.target: The IP address must be a valid IPv4 address.

trans-unit.source: VirtualNetworkSite
trans-unit.target: VirtualNetworkSite

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the Virtual Network site in which you want deploy your cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the Virtual Network site in which you want deploy your cloud service.

trans-unit.source: This setting does not create a Virtual Network Site.
trans-unit.target: This setting does not create a Virtual Network Site.

trans-unit.source: It references a site that has been previously defined in the network file for your Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: It references a site that has been previously defined in the network file for your Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: A cloud service can only be a member of one Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: A cloud service can only be a member of one Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify this setting, the cloud service will not be deployed to a Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify this setting, the cloud service will not be deployed to a Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Virtual Network site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Virtual Network site is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: InstanceAddress
trans-unit.target: InstanceAddress

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the association of a role to a subnet or set of subnets in the Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the association of a role to a subnet or set of subnets in the Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: When you associate a role name to an instance address, you can specify the subnets to which you want this role to be associated.
trans-unit.target: When you associate a role name to an instance address, you can specify the subnets to which you want this role to be associated.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>InstanceAddress</languageKeyword> contains a Subnets element.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>InstanceAddress</languageKeyword> contains a Subnets element.

trans-unit.source: The name of the role that is associated with the subnet or subnets is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>roleName</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the role that is associated with the subnet or subnets is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>roleName</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: Subnet
trans-unit.target: Subnet

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the subnet that corresponds to the subnet name in the network configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the subnet that corresponds to the subnet name in the network configuration file.

trans-unit.source: The name of the subnet is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the subnet is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.

trans-unit.source: ReservedIP
trans-unit.target: ReservedIP

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the reserved IP address that should be associated with the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the reserved IP address that should be associated with the deployment.

trans-unit.source: You must use Create Reserved IP Address to create the reserved IP address.
trans-unit.target: You must use Create Reserved IP Address to create the reserved IP address.

trans-unit.source: Each deployment in a cloud service can be associated with one reserved IP address.
trans-unit.target: Each deployment in a cloud service can be associated with one reserved IP address.

trans-unit.source: The name of the reserved IP address is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
trans-unit.target: The name of the reserved IP address is defined by a string for the <languageKeyword>name</languageKeyword> attribute.
